normalised: **Fiber to Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**

unnormalised: New Delhi – The aggressive rollout of Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTH) infrastructure continues across India, spearheaded by both public and private telecom operators. Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are leading the charge, aiming to connect millions of homes with high-speed broadband.
normalised: New Delhi – The aggressive rollout of Fiber to the Home (F T T H) infrastructure continues across India, spearheaded by both public and private telecom operators. Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are leading the charge, aiming to connect millions of homes with high speed broadband.

unnormalised: BSNL, the state-owned telecom provider, is also undertaking significant expansion efforts, particularly in rural areas under the BharatNet project, targeting gram panchayats by 31/03/2024. The initiative aims to bridge the digital divide and empower citizens with access to online education, healthcare, and e-governance services.
normalised: B S N L, the state owned telecom provider, is also undertaking significant expansion efforts, particularly in rural areas under the BharatNet project, targeting gram panchayats by thirty first march two thousand and twenty four. The initiative aims to bridge the digital divide and empower citizens with access to online education, healthcare, and e-governance services.

unnormalised: "We are committed to ensuring last-mile connectivity, even in the most remote regions like the Himalayan foothills," stated a BSNL spokesperson during a press briefing held at 11:00 hrs yesterday. Analysts predict a surge in FTTH subscriptions, expecting to reach 50 million connections by the end of FY25. Private players are investing heavily in laying optical fiber cables, with reports indicating over 2 million km laid since 2020. The increased competition is expected to drive down prices, making high-speed internet more accessible to the average Indian household. A new package costing Rs. 499 per month was announced by Airtel on 10/10/2024.
normalised: "We are committed to ensuring last mile connectivity, even in the most remote regions like the Himalayan foothills," stated a B S N L spokesperson during a press briefing held at eleven o'clock yesterday. Analysts predict a surge in F T T H subscriptions, expecting to reach fifty million connections by the end of F Y twenty five. Private players are investing heavily in laying optical fiber cables, with reports indicating over two million kilometer laid since two thousand and twenty. The increased competition is expected to drive down prices, making high speed internet more accessible to the average Indian household. A new package costing rupee four hundred and ninety nine per month was announced by Airtel on tenth october two thousand and twenty four.
